result.execSummary:
The defendant Byron D Beadles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery AMENDED FROM Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  No violent contact with the victim AML (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
